story.title: #SicilyExhibition Q&A
story.description: Curators Dirk Booms and Peter Higgs joined us for a Twitter Q&A about the exhibition Sicily: culture and conquest (21 April â 14 August 2016)

author.name: British Museum
author.bio: A museum of the world, for the world.

image.caption: Weâre here with #SicilyExhibition curators Dirk & Peter for our Twitter Q&A. What do you want to ask them? https://t.co/zuynJo313I

quote.text: Weâre here with #SicilyExhibition curators Dirk & Peter for our Twitter Q&A. What do you want to ask them? https://t.co/zuynJo313I
@britishmuseum What's your favourite place in Sicily and why? I have family in Agrigento so I'm really looking forward to to the exhibition!

image.caption: Curator Dirk Booms: My favourite place is Syracuse market, a taste of the real Sicily https://t.co/2ucEmhEwJO https://t.co/xjep7rK94T

quote.text: Curator Dirk Booms: My favourite place is Syracuse market, a taste of the real Sicily https://t.co/2ucEmhEwJO https://t.co/xjep7rK94T

image.caption: Curator Peter Higgs: You cannot beat wandering around the gigantic ruins and well-preserved temples in Agrigento https://t.co/XafljcpWat

quote.text: Curator Peter Higgs: You cannot beat wandering around the gigantic ruins and well-preserved temples in Agrigento https://t.co/XafljcpWat
1/2 @britishmuseum loved the exhibition and fascinated by the Augustus-like bust of Frederick II and figurines asserting imperial likeness.
2/2 @britishmuseum Is this evidence of a dominant cultural influence in Sicily at this time or was it a truly cosmopolitan society?
By the time of Frederick II, Sicily's multiculturalism had seriously declined in favour of Europe and Christianity (1/3)
Muslims and Orthodox Byzantines had been marginalised from Sicilian society during the turbulent years before Frederick's accession (2/3)
His intention was to found an empire as glorious as the Roman Empire â hence his Augustan-style portraiture (3/3) #SicilyExhibition
.@britishmuseum Why is the marble warrior statue from ancient Akragas (now #Girgenti) so important for the #SicilyExhibition? #SicilyCulture
Curator Peter: There is no usable marble source on Sicily, so the ancient Greeks had to import the stone from the Greek islands (1/2)

image.caption: Marble Greek-style statues are a rare find on Sicily. Recent conservation has also revealed traces of colour (2/2) https://t.co/VQBVzrZbPl

quote.text: Marble Greek-style statues are a rare find on Sicily. Recent conservation has also revealed traces of colour (2/2) https://t.co/VQBVzrZbPl
@britishmuseum Hi! Am coming to #SicilyExhibition Q. What are your favourite "must sees" from Norman period?

image.caption: Curator Dirk: This wooden panel was created by Fatimid craftsmen from Egypt for the Norman Palace in Palermo ... https://t.co/J0Dte6QsUY

quote.text: Curator Dirk: This wooden panel was created by Fatimid craftsmen from Egypt for the Norman Palace in Palermo ... https://t.co/J0Dte6QsUY

image.caption: ... And this tombstone for Anna was written in 4 languages, those of the 4 different peoples and cultures on Sicily https://t.co/1ldXrp7aoN

quote.text: ... And this tombstone for Anna was written in 4 languages, those of the 4 different peoples and cultures on Sicily https://t.co/1ldXrp7aoN
.@britishmuseum Many in UK will think Normans & the immediate reference is 1066. Did Norman rule of Sicily have any influence on them here?
Curator Dirk: Some think that William the Conqueror gained seafaring knowledge from his cousins' invasion of Sicily 5 years earlier...
... which is strange, given that the Normans descended from the great seafaring Vikings!
Later, Sicilian Norman King William II married Joan Plantagenet, daughter of Henry II. #SicilyExhibition
@britishmuseum many of the objects at #SicilyExhibition show how myth is used as a medium for cultural transmission across periods (1/2)
@britishmuseum Are you planning a special event on myth in Sicily?What are the myths you came across when putting together the exhib.? (2/2)

image.caption: Due to Sicily's fertile soil, Sicilian Greeks worshipped the goddesses of agriculture Demeter & Persephone above all https://t.co/CbOXk2Z6RA

quote.text: Due to Sicily's fertile soil, Sicilian Greeks worshipped the goddesses of agriculture Demeter & Persephone above all https://t.co/CbOXk2Z6RA
The legend of Persephone being taken into the underworld by her uncle Hades was adopted by the Greeks on Sicily: https://t.co/hGyP0xKwub
@britishmuseum What is it like to be a curator of such exhibition?
Curator Dirk: Exhilarating, but exhausting! It's wonderful to see it come together and be appreciated by so many #SicilyExhibition
Curator Peter: It's a fantastic chance to explore Sicily's museums and sites and to rediscover objects in the British Museum's collection
@Britishmuseum The #SicilyExhibition sounds like a great resource for writers to get inspiration. Any recommendations on where to start?

image.caption: Homer's Odyssey was a tale of epic exploration and some of it allegedly took place on Sicily https://t.co/Z7klVBHdMo https://t.co/GdX9otxtPb

quote.text: Homer's Odyssey was a tale of epic exploration and some of it allegedly took place on Sicily https://t.co/Z7klVBHdMo https://t.co/GdX9otxtPb
One of the greatest Sicilian novels is 'The Leopard', recounting the years around Garibaldi's unification of Italy https://t.co/CKfGiC8yAN
@britishmuseum would Peter & Dirk rather live in Archimedes' Syracuse or Roger II's Palermo? #SicilyExhibition
Curator Peter: It would have been exciting to live in Archimedes' Syracuse â but dangerous, as Roman invasion was just around the corner!
Curator Dirk: Roger II's Palermo must have been an amazing centre of learning and inspiration.
.@britishmuseum what is, in your opinion, the most beautiful and unique piece of the #SicilyExhibition?

image.caption: The only surviving mosaic from Palermo's Norman Cathedral is an exceptionally beautiful object in #SicilyExhibition https://t.co/Fh3mFyTaEt

quote.text: The only surviving mosaic from Palermo's Norman Cathedral is an exceptionally beautiful object in #SicilyExhibition https://t.co/Fh3mFyTaEt

image.caption: Thanks for all of your questions. Goodbye and good night from our #SicilyExhibition curators! đ https://t.co/KUoNRFXT4k

quote.text: Thanks for all of your questions. Goodbye and good night from our #SicilyExhibition curators! đ https://t.co/KUoNRFXT4k
